newsitem.title: USA: SOCCER-STRUGGLING METROSTARS ADD BRAZILIAN MIDFIELDER GUIDO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-STRUGGLING METROSTARS ADD BRAZILIAN MIDFIELDER GUIDO.

text.p: The New York/New Jersey MetroStars added Brazilian midfielder Guido to the team's roster, and coach Carlos Alberto Parreira is expected to use his new weapon Saturday against D.C. United.

The 21-year-old Guido, whose full name is Guido Alves Pereira Neto, came through the youth ranks of the Brazilian League's Sao Paulo FC, the club team that Parreira coached after leading Brazil to the 1994 World Cup.

A defensive midfielder, or libero, Guido made a pair of appearances with the MetroStars during pre-season training matches in Italy. He picked up an assist in the club's 2-1 loss to Italian Serie A club Reggiana on March 5.
Guido will join Roberto Donadoni and Mike Sorber as mainstays in the four midfielder alignment used by the team.

The MetroStars have dropped their first two contests of the season -- an opening shootout loss to the San Jose Clash and a 2-1 heartbreaker to the Tampa Bay Mutiny -- and face the reigning champion D.C. United on Saturday.
The team is also expected to announce the signing of defender Joao Luis from Vasco da Gamma of the Brazilian League.
